I totally understand, the only success i have had with urxvt and mousless copying is using hacks like piping the text you want copied into the clipboard (if you're wanting the copying done or available in X)
If you want copying between terminals, probably the best option is using a program like 'screen'
screen seemed more complicated the tmux but ofcource i dont know anything :) hardly the differense between emulator and console!
You're right, tmux would be better, i'm just old school so said screen
is ther no way to sync urxvt's paste buffer with xclip
I don't know of an automatic way to do this, but you can for instance do something like (ls | xclip -selection c -i)
would that sync the buffer towards x-clip ? so i could actually put that in a script. and how would i sync otherway?

Well in the example I gave (ls | xclip -selection c -i) it will copy the output from ls into xclip, if there's a command to echo the urxvt buffer then you could pipe that into xclip and the two buffers will be synced
so i could alias (| xclip -selection c -i) to copyx) and use that to pipe the outcome of tmux, or is the pastebuffer in a file or place i could cat ?
Yep an alias would be a good idea if you are going to use it a lot. For tmux there is 'tmux show-buffer'  so pipe that into the xclip thing and the xclip and tmux pastebuffers will be synced
